entry.title: Game: Door Kickers (Steam, 2014) (4)
entry.content:
Game: Door Kickers (Steam, 2014) (4)20171223
I played for another hour or so. This game is fun, but it is a bit
repetitive. I feel like I'm not learning a lot... like a puzzle
game that only has one or two tricks to it. I'm going to put it
back on the Queue and come back later.

Total time: 5:01

entry.title: Game: Final Fantasy 10 2 (HD Remaster) (PS3, 2014)
entry.content:
Game: Final Fantasy 10 2 (HD Remaster) (PS3, 2014)20171221
I started this today and had quite a blast playing it. It was hard
to find the ciphers on the beach but it was fun to walk around
fighting fiends along the way. The style of the game is very silly
and I like that a lot. There are a lot of things I don't
understand yet though. For example, I can't tell if I am leveling
up my characters or just particular dress spheres.

Total time: 1:45
  • Video Games
  • Final Fantasy 10 2 (HD Remaster)
  • PS3
  • 2014

entry.title: Game: Tokyo Jungle (PS3, 2012) (3)
entry.content:
Game: Tokyo Jungle (PS3, 2012) (3)20171220
I played through the Chick's level and then tried to do the Rabbit
but died instantly. The Chick really sucked because it moved so
slow. I also died the next story stage.

I love this review: Ellie Gibson, writing for Eurogamer, gave
Tokyo Jungle a 9/10, describing it as "basically Grand Theft Auto
with lions". and calling it "a celebration of classic games, with
their ridiculous plots, repetitive tasks, excessive violence and
all. It pulls off the impressive and nigh-on impossible trick of
being an original homage. Also it lets you set a giraffe on a
bear."

But despite this, it is really painful to play and the fighting is
not that great. The theme is so amazing though.

Total time: 2:56
  • Video Games
  • Tokyo Jungle
  • PS3
  • 2012

entry.title: Game: Tales of Vesperia (X360, 2008) (4)
entry.content:
Game: Tales of Vesperia (X360, 2008) (4)20171219
I played up through the mansion in the harbor. I'm getting very
tired of the game and think that I will not continue. The combat
is just not interesting enough and I'm not getting enough from the
story and the pleasure of seeing numbers get bigger. Sad, but it's
nice in one way to have more time.

Total time: 6:38
  • Video Games
  • Tales of Vesperia
  • X360
  • 2008

entry.title: Movie: The Last Jedi, starring Daisy Ridley (2017)
entry.content:
Movie: The Last Jedi, starring Daisy Ridley (2017)20171218
This was totally awesome. I loved it. There were so many things
that were so neat, but also strange.

I loved the opening and the way it amped up the action right
away. It was very weird though how Leia used super force powers to
get back on the ship, when it would be such a convenient place to
write her out of the story given that she died.

It was really neat to have Rey slowly learn from Luke, although it
was weird to not really know anything about how Ben went dark. It
was neat to have them connect in such a meaningful way.

The weird things going on for Finn and Rose was really strange, but
it created some nice moments. I loved that they ultimately failed
in their quest.

The fight between Kylo, Rey, and the guards was so awesome and the
fight afterwards was really cool too.

Luke's Force projection was really fun although it was kind of dumb
for him to quote Obi-Wan then not die, but die anyways. The ending
was really strange, because, who is this kid!?

So many funny jokes too. Nice!
  • Movies
  • 2017

entry.title: Game of Thrones - Season 2 - Episode 4 - Garden of Bones (4)
entry.content:
Game of Thrones - Season 2 - Episode 4 - Garden of Bones (4)20171218
It is remarkable how slow Dany's story moves this season. Tyrion
and Joffrey had the most intense scenes---one good and one very
bad. I enjoyed the conversations that Stannis and Renly were
in... yet another one of those times when things could have been
so different if people worked together more rather than just
fighting. The change in Arya's circumstances is fun too.

It was very interesting that Littlefinger lied about Arya.
  • TV Shows
  • Game of Thrones

entry.title: Game: Tales of Vesperia (X360, 2008) (2)
entry.content:
Game: Tales of Vesperia (X360, 2008) (2)20171215
I played a bit more and cured the tree, now I am in the city
underneath the caves. I got the ability to cook and another
character. I wish the cooking worked more like Graces, where it
happens automatically after battle. It's no wonder I liked that
game so much, there are some many cool things about it. I do like
the characters of this and I am engaged in the story.

Total time: 3:06
  • Video Games
  • Tales of Vesperia
  • X360
  • 2008

entry.title: Game: Tales of Vesperia (X360, 2008)
entry.content:
Game: Tales of Vesperia (X360, 2008)20171214
I played through the prologue, got outside, did some exploring and
got to the checkpoint. The game is fun and I like how fast it
opens. I like how it is like Symphonia in actually having a world
map, but more detailed because you can see what the enemies are. I
like the combat, although it is not quite as fast as either
Symphonia or Graces. I wish the benefits scaled with the
difficulty, so there'd be a reason to do it other than wanting to
grind more.

Total time: 1:40
  • Video Games
  • Tales of Vesperia
  • X360
  • 2008
